mn113:3.11: By rejecting social measures of worth and focusing on inner purity, they are the opposite of the meditator at [mn108:26.4](), who hides defilements within.
mn113:21.7: For _atammayatā_ see [mn47:13.4]() and my note there. Here it means that one’s spiritual goal is not limited to this attainment.
mn113:21.8: This saying also appears at [snp3.8:15.1]() and [snp3.12:52.1](), where it is not connected with absorption practice.
